Developer Terms of Use
des:
Voice control for your Wake Up Light just got more intuitive. Alexa now includes light’s color and brightness control. 
When using the skill, you need to specify by name which device to use. There are two ways to define names.
- Use the default name “Wake Up Light”, but you can change it in the Alexa App, Or
- Create an Alexa group and add the device to the group in the Alexa App, name the group Bedroom or others. More information is available at http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups

Here are some of our favorite phrase to get started：
Light Control:
-You can turn devices on/off, for example“Alexa, turn on Wake Up Light”or “Alexa, turn off my bedroom lights”.
Brightness Control:
-You can change the brightness, for example “Alexa, brighten bedroom to 50%”, or “Alexa, dim Wake Up Light”.
Color Control:
-You can change the color, for example “Alexa, set my Bedroom light to red”or “Alexa,change Wake Up Light to red”, try asking Alexa for “White”, “Red”, “Crimson”, “Salmon”, “Orange”, “Gold”, “Yellow”, “Green”, “Turquoise”, “Cyan”, “Sky Blue”, “Blue”, “Purple”, “Magenta”, “Pink” and “Lavender”.

How to Get Start？
1.Download Sleepace App in AppStore or GooglePlay and create a Sleepace account
2.Connect Wake Up Light to your Sleepace account
3.Open Alexa App, and go to “Skills”
4.Search for “Wake Up Light”
4.Enable the skill by clicking on the “Enable” button and log in to your Sleepace account
4.Say something to get start
